It can be life-threatening due to the risk of rapid progression to airway obstruction. The first step in managing Ludwig's angina is to secure the airway, but this is typically done non-surgically if possible. The next step is to start the patient on intravenous antibiotics and fluids to fight the infection and support the patient's overall health.
